CatDescriptText: Nick Manileas, cook, Wilkinsburg and Alberta Pounds, housewife, North Side, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 10, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that the 'Freedom Riders' should accede to Atty. Gen. Robert Kennedy's request for a 'cooling-off' period in their program to test segregation laws of certain Southern states?" Nick Manileas' answer reads: "I think he's about right.  I don't like to see people having trouble..."  Alberta Pounds' answer reads: "I think so.  They don't seem to be making any progress.  By cooling off, they might accomplish more."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Nick Manileas wearing light colored striped suit jacket, standing in front of store window and ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Alberta Pounds wearing textured dress with triangular pocket and hat, standing in front of store window
